result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W. Cousins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher W. Cousins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher W. Cousins was found guilty of Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

def. notice of certification - moved - left no address - unable to forward
per PO Shelly Hocker  - only owed on this case - no payments made to PO for this

11:40 a.m. Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf234, 15cf259, 16cf31. Attorney Burns has not been appointed - defendant notified of revocation - Burns not in receipt of revocation summary. Off record for discussion with client - 11:42 a.m. 
11:43 a.m. - On record - Burns statement that defendant wishes to proceed pro se - waiver free and voluntary - Defendant in receipt of revocation packet. Schiek/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence - all CC
16cf31
Jail - 6 months each count CC with Huber for all purposes. May serve in any county in State of Wisconsin.
Jail credit - 64 days

15cf259
Jail - 9 months with Huber for any purposes. May serve in any county in State of Wisconsin.
Jail credit - 122 days

15cf234
Jail - 9 months with Huber for any purposes. May serve in any county in State of Wisconsin. 
Jail credit - 122 days

Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment
Appeal rights given.
Any financial obligations in 16tr2026 and 16tr2027 may be served at $10 per day CC with any jail sentence.
Adj. 11:58 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

3:09 p.m. Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf259 and 15cf234. In 15cf234, State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Battery 940.19 (1)  and to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. In 15cf259, State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Mistreatment of an Animal and to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest pleas.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim rights complied with in both cases - Victim Impact Statements filed in 15cf259. Michlig/Schoenborn/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
In 15cf234
WHS/POP 2 years 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 20 days with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 9
AODA assessment and recovery
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

In 15cf259 concurrent to 15cf234
WHS/POP 2 years
CC/Supervision Fees
Jail - 20 days-cc to 15cf234, with Huber for all purposes
No ownership of any pets or live within a household that has pets, except fish
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal rights given
Defendant requests release from jail to pay rent/take care of matters - Court denies.
Adj. 3:39 p.m.

1:35 p.m. Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf234 and 15cf259. Court questions Schoenborn as to non-appearance - Attorney Schoenborn states defendant called him shortly after this morning's hearing - stated he thought the hearing was at 2:30 - asked for voluntary appearance to be set up. Michlig/Schoenborn/Court statement to modification of bail. Court modifies bail in 15cf259 to $1000 cash bail. Preliminary hearings scheduled in both cases. Adj. 1:43 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

11:41 a.m. Attorney Bryce Schoenborn in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf234 and 15cf259. Schoenborn statement to defendant's non-appearance. Schoenborn states has not been appointed in 15cf259. State moves for warrants in each file - Court authorizes warrants. Adj. 11:42 a.m.

from defendant at 12:16 p.m. - stated he just realized he has a warrant because he missed court - wants to schedule voluntary appearance this afternoon - told defendant to contact his attorney to schedule appearance - gave defendant Attorney Schoenborn's phone number

1:20 p.m. Defendant Christopher W. Cousins in court, via video, in custody with Attorney Bryce Schoenborn via telephone with leave of court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schoenborn not certain if he will be representing - Defendant needs to contact PD's office to apply for counsel -   In receipt of complaint, Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $5000 sig bond. Adj. 1:27 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.
